availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph P. Keaton (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Ashley Keaton in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on July 16, 1861. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, corporal, and sergeant, from October 8, 1861, to October 13, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 567.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Tipton County, District 12, pp. 175A-B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0173.
Headstone Applications for Military Veterans, 1925-1963, NARA RG 92, Roll 40110285405.
_Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pulaski County Marriages, Film 000804052.
